Class SecretsSerializer

java.lang.Object
com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializer<String>
uk.co.spudsoft.params4j.SecretsSerializer
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.jsonFormatVisitors.JsonFormatVisitable
public class SecretsSerializer extends com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonSerializer<String>
A JsonSerializer that prevents the output of a string value, replacing it with ********. If the value is null the serializer will output null, and if it is an empty string the output will be "". This behaviour makes it easy to detect whether a password has been set, without displaying it.
Author:
jtalbut

    • getDisabler

      public static com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.AnnotationIntrospector getDisabler()
      Return a Jackson AnnotionInspector that disables the SecretsSerializer. This AnnotationInspector extends the base JacksonAnnotationInspect and it should not be necessary to use the AnnotationIntrospectorPair. Typical usage would be: 
      ObjectMapper tempMapper = objectMapper.copy().setAnnotationIntrospector(SecretsSerializer.getDisabler());
String json = tempMapper.writeValueAsString(creds);
      Returns:
      a Jackson AnnotionInspector that disables the SecretsSerializer.
